summary: CVE-2018-16875 vulnerability detected in webpki-0.22.0 transitive dependency through reqwest, causing potential CPU denial of service in X.509 certificate verification. Issue was automatically closed and reopened multiple times as the dependency was toggled in inventory.
userImpact: Users running temporal-sdk-core could be vulnerable to CPU denial of service attacks through crafted X.509 certificate chains.
rootCause: webpki-0.22.0 (transitive dependency via reqwest) contains CVE-2018-16875, which allows CPU exhaustion during X.509 chain verification with pathological inputs.
proposedFix: Upgrade webpki to version 0.22.2 or higher, or use rustls-webpki versions 0.100.2 or 0.101.4.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by Mend as the vulnerable library was marked as ignored or removed from inventory, despite the CVSS 7.5 vulnerability persisting.
keyQuote: This issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library in the specific branch(es) was either marked as ignored or it is no longer part of the Mend inventory.
